hints.content: The parentheses tell us which two numbers to multiply first.

Rashawn solved the equation by multiplying $(\purpleE{2}\times\maroonE{5})$ first, and then multiplying by $\redE{4}$.

$\begin{align}
\redE{4} \times \purpleE{2} \times \maroonE{5} &= \redE{4}\times(\purpleE{2}\times\maroonE{5})\\\\
&=\redE{4}\times\goldE{10}\\\\ 
&=40
\end{align}$

In the new equation below, we want to multiply $(\redE{4}\times\purpleE{2})$ first, and then multiply by $\maroonE{5}$.

$\begin{align}
\redE{4} \times \purpleE{2} \times \maroonE{5} &=(\redE{4}\times\purpleE{2}) \times\maroonE{5}\\\\
&=\blueE{8}\times\maroonE{5}\\\\
&=40
\end{align}$

question.content:
Rashawn solved $\redE{4} \times \purpleE{2} \times\maroonE{5}$ using the equations below.

$\begin{align}
\redE{4} \times \purpleE{2} \times \maroonE{5} &=\redE{4}\times(\purpleE{2} \times\maroonE{5})\\\\ 
&=\redE{4}\times 10 \\\\\  
&=40
\end{align}$

**Use the equations below to solve $\redE{4} \times \purpleE{2} \times \maroonE{5}$ in a different way.**

||
-:|:-
$\redE{4} \times \purpleE{2} \times \maroonE{5}$ | $=(\redE{4}\times {}$ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]$)\times\maroonE{5}$  |
|$=$ [[☃ numeric-input 2]] ${}\times\maroonE{5}$|
|$= 40$|
